Sub-output 3 1. 1 CSO supported to monitor the implementation of the Bail Regulations and develop quarterly feedback reports 2. 1 CSO-Government interface forum established to support discussions on key developmental issues 3. 1 CSO supported to develop a referral pathway document for SGBV and to train CBOs for action at community levels.

Sub-output 1
1. 469 (M341, F128) jurors benefitted from one-day orientation session which enhanced their understanding of the operation of the jury system and on the professional and ethical conduct expected of them in the dispensation. Details include: 259 (M190, F69) in Freetown, 98 (M72, F26) in Makeni and 112 (M79, F33) in Bo. 2. 836 (M26, F10) including 16 (M9, F7) Registrars in Western Urban and Rural, 20 (M17, F3) Registrars, 10 each from High Court in Bo and Makeni. 3. Through support to LAB’s community paralegal services and advocacy in 810 (123 Boys, 209 Girls, 158 Males and 320 Females) people benefitted from LAB’s paralegal services in 234 cases in three chiefdoms in Kono district were able to access to remedy in cases involving maintenance, marital disputes, land disputes and inheritance. 14 Legal Aid Defence Counsels have provided Legal Representation to 48 inmates in criminal matters in 7 judicial locations, out of which 26 cases have been completed and 22 cases still ongoing. Moreover, out of the 22 cases ongoing; 8 cases were admitted to bail. A total of 36 cases were handled by Legal Aid Defence Counsels in the Model Sexual Courts in 7 judicial locations (Freetown, Bo, Makeni, Kabala, Waterloo, Port Loko and Kailahun) involving Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV). 400 Police Investigators and Prosecutors trained on the content of the 2017 Bail Regulations to enable them understand and apply the regulations consistently in their work in 8 districts across the country. 4. Nationwide Consultation on the review of the IPCB Regulations, 2013 and subsequent enactment of the Independent Policing Oversight Commission (IPOC) Act of Parliament held at regional level. 60 community stakeholders were consulted.
Sub-output 2 1. A total 644 (M431, F213) beneficiaries comprising 300 police officers, 23 PwD and other community residents sensitised on the Luanda Guidelines in workshops organised in 16 locations across the country. Media Campaign on IPCB Mandate and Luanda Guidelines: Two (2) TV and 20 radio discussion programmes were held to enhance public awareness on the mandate of the IPCB and the Luanda Guidelines. 2. No update available 3. No update available 4. Two (2) IPCB investigators recruited to enable them expedite investigation of cases to conclusion
Sub-output 3 1. One (1) CSO - CARL contracted to conduct extensive monitoring on the implementation of the Bail Regulation 2. No update available 3. One Community Referral Pathway developed to support survivors of SGBV. The process involved extensive consultation with community-based organisations and communities involving 40 (M21; F19) CSOs representatives engaged across 16 districts following engagements with local stakeholders, legal and medical structures. HUWASAL also carried out community outreach activities and raised awareness of of 111 (M76, F35) participants, including security forces, local councillors, chiefdom police, local court officials, traditional/religious authorities and Mammy Queens on SGBV and best human rights practices in the fight against the COVID-19 disease.

1 assessment of justice sector delivery carried out 8 decentralized quarterly coordination meetings organized by JSCO in Freetown and the Provinces. 20 Police stations, 25 Magistrate courts 4 functioning Jury panels with desk. 1 BSC and 1 JOMEM fully functioning 105 Judicial Officials including Judges and Magistrates benefitted in 6 (1 at national level and 5 trainings at regional level. 5 Correctional Centres

 Three (3) Correctional centres in Bo, Moyamba and Port Loko districts equipped with boreholes and water tower to address poor sanitary conditions  The Model Sexual Offences Court in Freetown supported with two motorbikes to expedite process serving and some information and communication technology (ICT) equipment. A total of 19 convictions secured out of 199 cases received within four months of the establishment of the SGBV Court.  50,000 face masks produced by SLCS to support the mask-up campaign, and 800 community mobilisers (volunteers) distributed the face masks to remote communities in the provinces.  In 2020, the project facilitated a countrywide tour of the SID of the SLCS on its routine oversight of correctional centre. Two (2) (100% of target) assessment monitoring missions to correctional centres in 8 districts were conducted.  150 (M120, F30) border security officers and community residents trained by IPCB, in collaboration with ONS and MRU Secretariat on cross-border community policing and preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Communication equipment (mobile phones and top up for 3 months) was provided to Sierra Leone Correctional Services (SLCS) to complement suspension of visitation to correctional centres and facilitate continuity of communication between inmates and families.
Essential hygiene items were also provided for five correctional isolation units (provisional detention isolation facilities for newly admitted inmates) within five correctional centres.

Output 1
- 600 felonious cases expedited utilizing 450 Jurors capacitated across 4 Regions to improve case dispensation - 850 cases are uploaded into the Justice App by Court Clerks post training. - 900 women and 100 girls are supported by the Legal Aid Board (LAB) with advisory, legal representation and paralegal services - 1,000 cases are heard under the Prison Courts through the Judiciary Week and extended prison courts. - 120 Family Support Unit (FSU) of the Sierra Leone Police (SLP) Police Investigators and Prosecutors capacitated with improved services to victims and reduced time processing of cases.
Output 2 - 650 inmates are provided with psychosocial counselling services from 35 additional case managers trained across 22 Correctional facilities. - 50 additional accounts opened to complement the implementation of the Correctional Service Earning Scheme and inmates reintegration efforts. - At least 14 facilities monitored to replicate best practices on inmates detention with minimal costs involvement.
Output 4
- 6,000 cases monitored by 1 CSO with support from 22 monitors across magistrates courts in Sierra Leone on the implementation of the Bail Regulations. - Draft Criminal Procedure Act (CPA) legislation enacted by Parliament into law. - 600 community residents and local and traditional leaders are capacitated with information on the Referral Pathway in the Eastern districts of Kono and Kailahun. - At least 50 convictions secured from legal prosecution of Sexual and Gender-Based Violence (SGBV) cases.
